q: said he and Google's founders are currently laying out the details of their management roles. He wrote about the move in a target="_blank"> blog post on the company's blog: As executive chairman, I will focus wherever I can add the greatest value: externally, on the deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership that are increasingly important given Google's global reach and internally as an advisor to Larry Page and Sergey[ Brin]. Eric Schmidt said the restructuring in management will produce "even better success" for the company. However, many analysts are skeptical as to whether Larry Page is ready to take on Google's top position.

Social Security supporters are adamant that the program will be repaid, just as the U.S. government repays others who invest in U.S. Treasury bonds. It's an IOU that is backed by Treasury bonds and the faith and credit of the United States government, said Sen. Bernie Sanders , I-Vt. the business so brilliantly," Larry Page said in the statement. Eric Schmidt said this change has been under discussion "for a long time" as the company tries to "simplify" its management structure. By clarifying our individual roles we'll create clearer responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. In my clear opinion, Larry Page is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, he said in the statement.
